definition: lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk

sentences.english: He nodded out home last night.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚回家时已烂醉如泥。

sentences.english: He is dead drunk. He's been drinking with his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他烂醉如泥，他刚才一直在和朋友们喝酒。

sentences.english: Well, okay, I still get stoned.
He came home totally rat-arsed last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上他回到家的时候已完全烂醉如泥。

sentences.english: They staggered out of the pub, completely drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他们烂醉如泥，踉踉仓仓的走出酒馆。

sentences.english: Drew: Well, you could say, I feel really rotten.
sentences.chinese: 那，你还可以说，我喝得烂醉如泥。

sentences.english: He got absolutely sozzled at the Christmas party.
sentences.chinese: 他在圣诞节聚会上烂醉如泥。

sentences.english: A peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked.
sentences.chinese: 啄烂醉如泥的胡椒彼得吹笛者被选。

sentences.english: After 20 beers steve really got blitzed (out) last night .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫昨夜喝了20杯啤酒，烂醉如泥。

sentences.english: Fatima: You're stinking drunk and this date is over. Capisce?
sentences.chinese: 你已经烂醉如泥了，约会结束了，明白吗？

sentences.english: He was dead drunk in the New Year Eve party.
sentences.chinese: 他在除夕晚会上喝得烂醉如泥。

sentences.english: He was really poleaxed last night.
Dogs never smoke or drink under the table.
sentences.chinese: 狗不抽烟或喝得烂醉如泥。

definition: dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
variant of 醉醺醺[zui4 xun1 xun1]
to get drunk and act crazy/roaring drunk
alcohol drunk to drown one's sorrows
to force sb to drink alcohol
to fuddle/to befuddle/to inebriate/to get someone drunk
